newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds closed a touch higher on Wednesday with prices lingering at closing levels for most of the afternoon.
Dealers said weaker than expected U.S. construction spending failed to boost trade.
"The figure was better than expected," said a dealer after the U.S. announced a 1.4 percent fall in construction spending in July. "But oddly enough there was no reaction in the market."
Dealers said Thursday German unemployment data could have some impact, but most market players were waiting for Friday's U.S. August jobs data.
The consensus for August U.S. payrolls is set at 244,000, with forecasts ranging from 150,000 to 280,000.
"We are holding our breath for those figures," said one dealer, adding the market could not afford a figure of 275,000 or higher.
Another dealer said he expected more swapping from guilder bonds into German debt if the yield gap keeps widening.
The January 2006 bond rose 0.12 to 97.88/96, with a bid yield of 6.30 percent or nine basis points below the April 2006 versus minus eight on Tuesday.
